title: undermined the legitimacy
extract: uk ​ /ˌʌn.dəˈmaɪn/ us ​ /ˌʌn.dɚˈmaɪn/ C2 to make someone less confident, less powerful, or less likely to succeed, or to make something weaker, often gradually: The president has accused two cabinet members of working secretly to undermine his position/him. Criticism just undermines their confidence.
extract_html: uk ​ /ˌʌn.dəˈmaɪn/ us ​ /ˌʌn.dɚˈmaɪn/ C2 to make someone less confident, less powerful, or less likely to succeed, or to make something weaker, often gradually: The president has accused two cabinet members of working secretly to undermine his position/him. Criticism just undermines their confidence.
